word: It may sometimes be necessary, however, to select a site on which no improvements have been made and no buildings erected. In such a case, we must be careful not to select a place which will of necessity require a large outlay of means for improvements. Through lack of experience, and miscalculations, we may be entrapped into the incurring of large debts, because the buildings and improvements cost two or three times as much as was estimated.--Ms 114, 1902, p. 2. ("Instruction Regarding Sanitarium Work." Typed Sept. 1, 1902.)
